awd_titl_txt: Planning: Planning Grant for EPSCOR Chemurgy 2.0 - Advanced Biomanufacturing for Next-Generation, Bio-inspired Products
awd_abstract_narration:
The activities proposed in this planning grant are intended to support the development of a meritorious
RII Track-1 program for the state of Iowa. This program will be state-wide, with integration of individual
researchers, institutions and organizations. It will both build research capacity, in order to implement a
sustained increase in research competitiveness, and build human infrastructure in the form of
broadening participation and workforce development. During implementation of the planning grant, the team
will assess the existing research and human infrastructure, coordinate and plan state-wide efforts, host
an all-hands meeting, and develop a collaboration plan.

The planning grant from Iowa State University presents a  plan for the development of a Chemurgy 2.0 proposal 
for submission to the FY23 RII Track-1 competition.  Planning activities have been ongoing for several months 
now, and the funding requested will allow a consultant to orchestrate the discussions within Iowa needed 
to formulate a strong full proposal.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
The goal of this planning grant was to develop a meritorious EPSCoR RII Track-1 proposal for the state of Iowa. If our proposal is selected for funding, we will develop a state-wide program, with integration of individual researchers, institutions and organizations. This program will both build research capacity, in order to implement a sustained increase in research competitiveness, and build human infrastructure in the form of broadening participation and workforce development. Implementation of this planning grant, is to include assessment of our existing research and human infrastructure, coordination and planning of state-wide efforts, and development of a collaboration plan.

 

This planning grant allowed us to develop a stronger proposal with better representation of Iowa researchers and institutions and more likely to benefit Iowa’s students, workforce and residents. As part of the planning grant implementation, we were able to hold two workshops to discuss Iowa’s strengths, weaknesses and needs in the field of advanced biomanufacturing. These workshops helped us to put together a strong team of researchers with a diverse leadership structure and partnerships with programs for broadening participation. The planning grant also supported a team science professional development activity for the leadership team. This training improved our ability to process ideas and feedback from all team members.

 

We were successful in preparing and submitting our RII Track-1 proposal. The proposal is still under review, we are eagerly waiting to learn of the funding decision.

 


Last Modified: 04/04/2023
Modified by: Laura Jarboe
